High quality sources (NCCAM and metanalyses) say there is a controversy on Homeopathy - theory and evidence (look at the talkpage) - So the use of teh word "controversy" is justified.
No, there is no good evidence for efficacy and much against, this is an undue weight issue
"The controversy on the evidence" is more neutral and consistent with the sources + reality. I did not see any objection. Please, if you revert justify- talk page.
beg to differ. These are statements of fact not an opinion of critics. This is a due weight issue. Please discuss on talk page

Until a more neutral review of the research on homeopathy is provided, it is not appropriate to simply cherry-pick negative trials or to selectively interpret studies previously referenced.
